intro: Dyschoriste cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. Dyschoriste cubensis thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
